title: What are the flats of the key signature that has 3 flats? - Quora

response.answer_text: They’re B flat, E flat, and A flat. This is the key of E Flat major, or C minor. If you don’t know the 24 major and minor keys and the corresponding key signatures, one ‘painles’ way to learn them is to review exercise 39 in Hanson’s ‘The Virtuoso Pianist.’ Even if you’re a flautist, cellist, or any other instrument, it’s best to know this basic music theory. Then you’ll be in line for conducting.

B E A. To know all the sharps or flats in any key signature, remember this sentence both ways round: SHARPS: Father Charles Goes Down And Ends Battle FLATS Battle Ends And Down Goes Charles' Father As to what key it is: The last sharp is the 7th in the scale The last flat is the fourth in the scale
